text: The 2017 CAF Super Cup (officially the 2017 Total CAF Super Cup for sponsorship reasons) was the 25th CAF Super Cup, an annual football match in Africa organized by the Confederation of African Football (CAF), between the winners of the previous season's two CAF club competitions, the CAF Champions League and the CAF Confederation Cup. The match was played between Mamelodi Sundowns of South Africa, the 2016 CAF Champions League winners, and TP Mazembe of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, the 2016 CAF Confederation Cup winners. It was hosted by Mamelodi Sundowns at the Loftus Versfeld Stadium in Pretoria on 18 February 2017. Mamelodi Sundowns defeated TP Mazembe 1–0 to win their first CAF Super Cup. ==Teams== {| class="wikitable" |- !Team !Zone !Qualification !Previous appearances (bold indicates winners) |- | Mamelodi Sundowns |COSAFA (Southern Africa) |2016 CAF Champions League winners |None |- | TP Mazembe |UNIFFAC (Central Africa) |2016 CAF Confederation Cup winners |3 (2010, 2011, 2016) |} ==Venue== {| |Loftus Versfeld Stadium in Pretoria, South Africa, hosted the match. |} ==Format== The CAF Super Cup was played as a single match, with the CAF Champions League winners hosting the match. If the score was tied at the end of regulation, extra time would not be played, and the penalty shoot-out would be used to determine the winner (CAF Champions League Regulations XXVII and CAF Confederation Cup Regulations XXV). ==Match== ===Details=== {| width=92% |- | | |} {| width="100%" |valign="top" width="40%"| {| style="font-size:90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" |- !width=25| !!width=25| |- |GK ||14|| Denis Onyango |- |RB ||27|| Thapelo Morena |- |CB ||6 || Wayne Arendse |- |CB ||16|| Ricardo Nascimento |- |LB ||4 || Tebogo Langerman |- |CM ||13|| Tiyane Mabunda |- |CM ||8 || Hlompho Kekana (c) |- |RW ||28|| Anthony Laffor || || |- |AM ||26|| Khama Billiat || || |- |LW ||18|| Themba Zwane || || |- |CF ||22|| Percy Tau || |- |colspan=3|Substitutes: |- |GK ||1 || Kennedy Mweene |- |DF ||20|| Anele Ngcongca || || |- |DF ||29|| Soumahoro Bangaly || || |- |MF ||11|| Sibusiso Vilakazi || || |- |MF ||15|| Lucky Mohomi |- |MF ||19|| Mzikayise Mashaba |- |FW ||25|| Leonardo Castro |- |colspan=3|Manager: |- |colspan=3| Pitso Mosimane |} |valign="top"|300px |valign="top" width="50%"| {| style="font- size:90%; margin:auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" |- !width=25| !!width=25| |- |GK ||22|| Sylvain Gbohouo |- |RB ||5 || Issama Mpeko || |- |CB ||2 || Joël Kimwaki || |- |CB ||6 || Salif Coulibaly |- |LB ||3 || Jean Kasusula |- |CM ||13|| Nathan Sinkala |- |CM ||19|| Daniel Nii Adjei |- |RW ||20|| Solomon Asante |- |AM ||18|| Rainford Kalaba (c) || || |- |LW ||23|| Elia Meschak || || |- |CF ||28|| Ben Malango |- |colspan=3|Substitutes: |- |GK ||21|| Ley Matampi |- |DF ||14|| Kabaso Chongo |- |MF ||10|| Given Singuluma |- |MF ||16|| Christian Koffi |- |FW ||8 || Trésor Mputu || || |- |FW ||9 || Déo Kanda |- |FW ||11|| Adama Traoré || || |- |colspan=3|Manager: |- |colspan=3| Thierry Froger |} |} {| width=50% style="font-size: 90%" | Assistant referees: Redouane Achik (Morocco) Waleed Ahmed Ali (Sudan) Fourth official: Youssef Essrayri (Tunisia) |} ==Prize money== The winners would receive $100,000 USD in prize money while the runners-up would receive $75,000 USD. ==See also== *2016 CAF Champions League Final *2016 CAF Confederation Cup Final ==References== ==External links== *Total Super Cup 2017, CAFonline.com 2017 Super CSC CSC Category:February 2017 sports events in Africa
